messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., yjin68@y... wrote:
> Is anyone have an idea of using junit to test CORBA IDL? I think The
> TestSuite just accept *.class file, since CORBA IDL is
specification,
> how can I use Junit to test IDL? Someone help me out!

You must be very careful to define what it means to test an interface
definition (I and D from IDL). Generally, specifications are
reviewed; implementations are tested. There are no semantic
expressions in IDL.

I personally see little point to interface testing if there will be a
single implementation. So, I will assume you are in a situation where
there are multiple objects implementing the interfaces in question.

The only added complexity in this situation, as compared to non-CORBA
unit testing, is getting ahold of the object to test. I think
somebody already described connecting to the service to get named
objects.

Actually, because of CORBA, you have more options at your disposal.
Consider a test service that manages references to objects you are
testing. This gives you a central place to find things. Particularly
useful for unnamed objects.

I particularly like the later solution because it removes knowledge
about the implementation under test from the test suite. To test a
new implementation, change the reference in your managing service and
rerun the suite.
